description: Create a single clump from a template. If no size measure is given, then the clump template volume is retained. If the density keyword is not given, then the clump is given unit density. This command creates a single clump instance, contrasting with clump generate which creates multiple clumps.

keywords.name: name
keywords.description: Name of the clump template to be replicated (required)

keywords.name: position
keywords.description: Clump position. Default: origin. Cannot be given with original-position keyword

keywords.name: position-x
keywords.description: X-component of clump position. Default: 0. Cannot be given with original-position keyword

keywords.name: position-y
keywords.description: Y-component of clump position. Default: 0. Cannot be given with original-position keyword

keywords.name: position-z
keywords.description: Z-component of clump position (3D ONLY). Default: 0. Cannot be given with original-position keyword

keywords.name: original-position
keywords.description: Specify that the clump centroid will be set to the original position of the clump template when it was created. Cannot be given with position keywords

keywords.name: diameter
keywords.description: Volume is set to be equivalent to the volume of a disk of unit thickness (2D) or sphere (3D) with diameter fdiam

keywords.name: size
keywords.description: Scale the clump to have a volume of fvol. In 2D, the volume assumes disk with unit thickness

keywords.name: fish-size
keywords.description: Use the FISH function sfname to scale the 'size' of the clump template to fval. The FISH function must take a single argument that is a clump pointer and return a floating point value corresponding to a linear measure of the clump size

keywords.name: angle
keywords.description: Angle about which to rotate the clump in degrees via the right-hand rule. If no angle is specified, then no rotation will occur. In 2D, rotation occurs in the out-of-plane direction

keywords.name: axis
keywords.description: Axis about which to rotate the clump. If no axis is specified, then no rotation occurs

keywords.name: id
keywords.description: Clump ID. Default: next available ID

keywords.name: group
keywords.description: The group slot slot is set to s for the newly created clump. If slot is not specified, then s is assigned to the group slot Default. The pebble keyword specifies that the group is assigned to the pebbles and not to the clump

notes: A model domain must be specified prior to clump replication
The replicated clump must fall entirely within the model domain
While cycling, clumps can only be created before cycle point 0 (i.e., when the timestep is calculated)
If no size measure is given, the clump template volume is retained
Default density is 1.0 if not specified
Cannot use both position and original-position keywords simultaneously
Rotation is applied via angle and axis keywords using right-hand rule

examples.description: Create a clump from template 'ball1'. Size set from diameter of equivalent circle (2D) or sphere (3D)
Create a clump from template 'rock1' with size from equivalent sphere diameter and specified position

examples.command: clump replicate name 'triad' position 0.5 0.5 1.5 diameter 0.25 axis 0 1 1 angle 45
examples.description: Create a clump from template 'triad' with position, size, and orientation (rotated 45Â° about axis (0,1,1))

examples.command: clump replicate name 'template1' original-position density 2500 id 100
examples.description: Create clump at template's original position with density 2500 and ID 100

examples.command: clump replicate name 'rock' size 1.5 group 'aggregate' slot 'material'
examples.description: Create clump with volume 1.5, assign to group 'aggregate' in slot 'material'

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('clump replicate ...') - Python SDK cannot directly replicate clumps from templates
